string.text: Pliers

Basic slip joint pliers. Finding tools that aren't rusted in the Zone is a challenge as few people think of bringing these from the outside. These are good for holding large objects in place but are very big and chunky.
Flat head screwdriver
Large flat head screwdriver. Can be used for unscrewing, prying, or as a makeshift chisel in a pinch. Very useful.
Wrench
Wrench likely taken from an automotive shop or something. Fits only two sizes of hex nut.
Needlenose pliers
Smaller set of pliers with tapered jaws. Allows for manipulation of small things and is very useful to fish things out of holes. These have a brushed finish.
Screwdriver set

Set of small and thin Phillips and flathead screwdrivers. Designed for compactness and utility over pure torque application. Not in demand for stalkers but mechanics make good use of these to maintain equipment and tinker.
Ratcheting wrench

Ratcheting wrench with adjustable clamping head that can fit multiple sizes of nut or bolt. Less sturdy than single piece wrenches but can fit smaller bolts with less fuss. Probably the best choice to hold or turn bolts with, whatever applications of such are in the Zone.
Set of small files
Set of professionally made files with different patterns and grit. Very high quality and likely procured from a machine shop or factory.
Torque screwdriver and bit set

Torque screwdriver with a set of screwdriver heads, including Philips, flat, hexagonal and Torx. Adjustable torque setting allows the mechanic to set the exact required tightness of a fastening. Very rare and not used much in the Zone except to maintain otherwise finicky exoskeleton frames.
Set of tweezers
Set of fine tweezers. Commonly used to manipulate solder or place electronic chips.
Portable Soldering Iron

Portable soldering iron with battery pack. Some ingenious soul managed to encapsulate a Flash artifact in the batteries, giving it limitless power. Said person also forgot to include a means to hold the hot iron when not in use. Be careful not to burn yourself!
Micrometer
Precision mechanical calliper that can take measurements as accurate as 1/100th of a millimeter. Produced in Germany.
Hammer with pin punches

Small hammer with a set of standard sized pin punches. Used for advanced disassembly of weapons and weapon components, as well as adjusting iron sights. Common with organized groups in the Zone that have the time and luxury to fine-tune their weapons.
Portable ammo press
Adjustable ammo press that fits any brass case from pistol to rifle. Just mount to a sturdy table and press your worries away!
Powder measuring kit
Set of funnels, cups and scales used to measure and pour propellant. A must-have for any respectable hand loader.
Case trimmer and deburring tool
A hand-operated brass case trimmer with an insert to deburr the case lip.
